original: Edlund, Johan Oskar, rektor, Var-berg, f. 27/l/9’2 i Borgsjö, Västernorrl. 1., av skogsfaktor Daniel E. o. Gus-tafva Westerlund. G. 22 m. Hedvig Hagelberg. Barn: Björn f. 23, bygg- n:ing., Gunhild 28. — Stud:ex. i Sundsvall 10, fil. mag. i Upps. 13, fil. lic. 20, provår v. norra real i Sthlm 29. Vik. adj. i Strängnäs 15, vik. lär. v. Vallens folksk. i Sättna s. å., ob-servat. v. Pårtetjåkko observ. 16-17, meteorolog v. statens meteorol.-hyd-rogr. anst. 18-20, 29, 32 o. 33, e. o. tj :man v. statskont. riksboksl :byrå 19, meteorolog v. geofys. inst. i Tromsö 20-22, bestyrer f. meteorol. avd. där 22-26, vik. adj. i Borås 28, vik. v, norra latin o. norra real i Sthlm 29, vik. ämneslär. i Ljusdal 30, e. lär. i Luleå 30-32, adj. i Boden 32, lektor i matem. o. fysik i Umeå 33, rektor v. Varbergs samrealsk. sed. 38. Ledare av Con-rad-Holmboe-exp. t. farvattn. v. Öst-grönl. 23. Sekr. i Varbergs hyres-gästfören. sed. 41, led. av hyresndn i Varberg sed. 42. Skr.: div. avh. o. upps. i meteorol. o. oceanograf, ämnen.
translated: Edlund, Johan Oskar, principal, Varberg, b. 27/1/92 in Borgsjö, Västernorrl. county, son of timber factor Daniel E. and Gustafva Westerlund. Married in 1922 to Hedvig Hagelberg. Children: Björn b. 1923, in construction, Gunhild b. 1928. He passed his high-school exam in Sundsvall in 1910, received an MA in Uppsala in 1913, became a PhD in 1920, and spent some time as a teaching assistant at the north school in Stockholm in 1929. He was a temporary teacher at Strängnäs in 1915, temporary teacher at the Vallens school in Sättna the same year, observer at the Pårtetjåkko observatory in 1916-17, meteorologist at the State Meteorological-Hydrographical Institute in 1918-20, 1929, 1932-33, temporary official with the State Accounting Bureau in 1919, meteorologist at the Geophysical Institute in Tromsø from 1920-22, manager of the meteorological department there from 1922-26, temporary teacher in Borås in 1928, temporary subject teacher in Ljusdal in 1930, permanent teacher in Luleå in 1930-32, adjunct in Boden in 1932, and mathematics and physics lecturer in Umeå in 1933. He became principal of the Varberg secondary school in 1938. He served as leader of the Conrad-Holmboe Expedition for water research in East Greenland in 1923, and he was secretary of the Varberg tenants' association starting in 1941, a member of the Varberg rent control board starting in 1942. He has written various papers and essays on meteorology and oceanography.
